title: Sources: Saints' Mathieu, Jordan take pay cuts
content: Tyrann Mathieu and Cameron Jordan will sign new deals with expected pay decreases instead of the traditional restructures the Saints have used on several players' contracts this offseason to free up salary cap space, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Mac Jones has 2-year deal with 49ers
content: Mac Jones, who wanted an opportunity to work with coach Kyle Shanahan, agreed to terms with the 49ers on a deal worth $7 million with $5 million guaranteed, sources said.

title: Minnesota fires Johnson after 4 years as coach
content: Ben Johnson had served as Minnesota coach since 2021-22 but was unable to return the Gophers to the NCAA tournament.

title: Simeone: 'Ball doesn't move' on disallowed pen
content: Diego Simeone questioned the decision to disallow Julián Álvarez's crucial penalty in Real Madrid's Champions League shootout win over Atlético Madrid, insisting "the ball doesn't move" after VAR decided the forward had kicked the ball twice.

title: AAC requiring minimum $10M payout to athletes
content: The American Athletic Conference will require each member except Army and Navy to provide athletes with at least $10 million in additional benefits over the next three years.

title: Montour nets NHL's fastest OT goal at 4 seconds
content: Brandon Mountour's goal just four seconds into overtime set an NHL record for fastest OT goal, lifting the Kraken past the Canadiens 5-4.

title: Woman who accused Worthy gets protective order
content: Attorneys for Tia Jones confirmed she was granted a protective order against Chiefs receiver Xavier Worthy, adding that she is "fully cooperating with law enforcement as they continue to actively investigate the violence that occurred."

title: Men's Bracketology: North Carolina climbs to 'last team in'
content: The Tar Heels improved their NCAA tournament hopes with Wednesday's second-round ACC tournament win over Notre Dame.

title: From $342.58 to over $1M, how some NFL players made out with performance bonuses
content: Brock Purdy nearly doubled his salary with performance-based pay, but other payouts were much more modest.

title: Women's Bracketology: SDSU seals spot, but all eyes on Ivy Madness
content: With the final two teams in the field facing off Friday, the center of the Bracketology universe is Providence, Rhode Island.

title: From a South Carolina repeat to UConn ending its title drought: Six teams that could win it all
content: Sixty-eight teams will compete in  March Madness. But these six make up the short list of title contenders.

title: NHL playoff watch: Where will the Devils finish?
content: New Jersey currently holds the No. 3 seed in the Metro, but could drop to a wild-card spot -- or worse.

title: Quarterfinal predictions, from Real Madrid-Arsenal to Villa-PSG
content: The round of 16 is over and after some amazing Champions League action, what will happen in the next round?

title: UCL quarterfinals bracket set as Real face Arsenal
content: The Champions League quarterfinals bracket was set Wednesday, and it sends Real Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain toward more English teams standing in their path of the title.

title: 'We want more': Villa dreaming of toppling PSG
content: Aston Villa boss Unai Emery is thrilled to have steered his side into a Champions League quarterfinal, but now wants even more as they face a daunting clash with Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Bellingham: Madrid 'change mentality' in big games
content: Jude Bellingham said his Real Madrid team has the ability to change their mentality for big games, as they edged past city rivals Atlético Madrid on penalties to reach the Champions League quarterfinals on Wednesday.

title: Amorim: Players can't argue with Ratcliffe criticism
content: Ruben Amorim has told his Manchester United players that they cannot have any complaints about criticism from co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

title: Swanson to miss NWSL start for personal reasons
content: Chicago Stars FC forward Mallory Swanson will miss the start of the 2025 National Women's Soccer League season due to personal reasons, the club confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Messi set to return for Inter Miami in Jamaica
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano confirmed Lionel Messi will be traveling with the team to Jamaica to face Cavalier FC in the second leg of the Concacaf Champions Cup round-of-16 series Thursday at Kingston's Independence Park.

title: Ronaldo withdraws from CBF presidential race
content: Brazil football great Ronaldo said that he was pulling out of the race to be president of his country's football association (CBF) on Wednesday after failing to gather enough support from regional federations to present a candidacy.

title: Dick Vitale hands out the only postseason awards that matter
content: With Cooper Flagg mentions galore, here are the best players of the 2024-25 men's college hoops season, according to Dick Vitale.

title: Watkins, Bueckers, Hidalgo headline All-America team -- but who's player of the year?
content: Our experts name their women's college basketball player of the year, All-Americans and biggest surprise.

title: The King, The Stilt and a Splash Brother: Meet the holders of the NBA's most unbreakable records
content: After LeBron James crossed the 50,000-point mark, and Stephen Curry about to surpass an unprecedented 4,000 three-pointers, here are other NBA records that, for now, look to be unbreakable.

title: Maurice Cheeks reunites with Trail Blazers national anthem singer he aided
content: Prior to a 2003 Trail Blazers playoff game, 13-year-old Natalie Gilbert stumbled on her words while performing the national anthem before then-Portland head coach Maurice Cheeks stepped up to help.

title: Men's pound-for-pound rankings: Where does Bivol land after win? How about 'Tank' Davis?
content: A lot of movement in the top 10, including the return of Junto Nakatani, and Dmitry Bivol jumping over Artur Beterbiev. Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: UFC expert picks, best bets: How Vettori can win in return from layoff
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: PFL 2025: What are the fights and potential matchups to look forward to?
content: The new season of PFL brings new fighters and new weight classes. Here are the best matchups and the reason why you should watch.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Isak firms as Arsenal's No. 1 target
content: Goal-shy Arsenal reportedly have Newcastle's Alexander Isak at the top of their summer shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Roundtable: Top takeaways from watching March baseball
content: Our fantasy experts discuss which players have stood out this spring, and what it could mean for the season ahead.

title: "Breather For Ukraine Army": Top Putin Aide Criticises Ceasefire Proposal
content: A top Kremlin aide said Thursday that any Ukraine peace settlement must secure Russia's "interests", and that President Vladimir Putin would probably give his opinion on a 30-day US ceasefire proposal later.

title: Tamil Nadu Replaces Rupee Symbol In State Budget Amid Massive Row With Centre
content: Tamil Nadu on Thursday replaced the rupee symbol in promotional material for the 2025/26 state budget - which will be presented Friday morning - with a Tamil letter.

title: How Mohali Parking Row Led To Scientist's Death. His Mother Narrates Horror
content: Dr Abhishek Swarnkar, the 39-year-old scientist who died in Mohali after being assaulted over a parking row, was attacked after he warned the accused that he would file a complaint against him

title: 25-Year-Old Stops 3 Men From Applying Holi Colours, Strangled To Death
content: A 25-year-old man was allegedly strangled to death in Rajasthan's Dausa district for trying to stop three men from applying colour on him ahead of Holi, police said on Thursday.

title: "Blot On Democracy": KTR On Warpath, Targets Congress Over MLA Suspension
content: There was chaos inside (and outside) the Telangana Assembly Thursday after Bharat Rashtra Samithi MLA Jagadish Reddy was suspended - for allegedly accusing Speaker Gaddam Prasad Kumar of bias - for the rest of this session.

title: How Ranya Rao Was Handed Gold At Dubai Airport To Be Smuggled To India
content: Actor Ranya Rao had prepared a meticulous plan to smuggle gold bars from Dubai and learnt how to conceal it in her clothing on YouTube, according to a document detailing the authorities' objections to her bail request.

title: Chennai Doctor Dies By Suicide With Wife, 2 Sons; Cops Say He Had Huge Debt
content: A family of four - a doctor, his wife and two sons - were found dead at their home in Chennai's Anna Nagar this morning. The police suspect they died by suicide because of financial problems.

title: 23-Year-Old Killed By Father, Brother Day After Her Wedding In Noida
content: A woman was found dead at her home in Noida just a day after she married her boyfriend against her family's wishes. She was strangled by her father and brother, who cremated her body soon after to conceal the evidence.

title: How A Hitman's Fast Food Order, Bad Texting Skills Foiled A Murder Plot
content: It was July 2022 when 27-year-old Khalid Mehdiyev, a self-proclaimed member of the Russian mob, set off on a mission to assassinate Iranian-American journalist and activist Masih Alinejad

title: Star Aus Pacer Reignites CT 2025 'Unfair Advantage' Row: "When One Team..."
content: Australian cricket team star pacer Mitchell Starc believes that India had a clear advantage during the Champions Trophy 2025 as they played at just one venue.

title: "Designed By Tamilian": K Annamalai's "Stupid" Barb At DMK Amid Rupee Row
content: Hitting back at the DMK for replacing the rupee symbol in promotional material for the Tamil Nadu budget, BJP state President K Annamalai has said the party is so "stupid" that it doesn't realise that the symbol was designed by a Tamilian.

title: Ignored Pujara's Message To BCCI Ahead of England Tests: "If I Was..."
content: Veteran Indian cricket team batter Cheteshwar Pujara sent a strong message to the selectors ahead of the Test series against England.

title: Opinion: Can The 'Nepo Baby' Please Speak Up?
content: Is our collective curiosity about nepo babies motivating makers to make subpar films only to kindle public discourse? If streaming sites feed on engagement, then every view is a good view, after all.

title: Scientist Dies After Neighbour Assaults Him During Parking Row In Mohali
content: A 39-year-old scientist working at the Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER), Mohali, has died after a parking dispute near his rented home in Sector 67 turned violent.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Amid ongoing diplomatic chill, India & Bangladesh conduct naval exercise
content: Diplomatic tensions between India and Bangladesh persist, but their military cooperation remains robust. The recent 'Bongosagar' naval exercise showcased joint efforts to tackle maritime challenges and improve operational coordination, highlighting the ongoing strategic importance of collaboration despite regional geopolitical complexities.

title: Territory, tariffs and chaos: 10 ways Trump shook the world in 50 days
content: US President Donald Trump’s early moves in his second term disrupted global diplomacy, alienated allies, and uplifted rivals. Key changes included abandoning Ukraine, floating territorial expansions, pressuring Nato, and reducing foreign aid under Elon Musk’s guidance. This shift has heightened European defense discussions and empowered China and Russia on the global stage.

title: Russia to reject Trump's Ukraine deal? What Putin's aide said
content: Russian forces have regained control of Sudzha in the Kursk region from Ukrainian forces. This follows President Vladimir Putin's visit, advocating for swift liberation, and coincides with U.S.-Ukrainian ceasefire talks. The regainment threatens Ukraine's bargaining position amid ongoing negotiations.

title: Days after train siege, terrorists attack army camp in Pakistan
content: Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) executed a suicide attack on the Jandola military base in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, leading to the Pakistan Army killing eight to nine militants. Following the explosion, heavy gunfire ensued near the Frontier Corps camp in South Waziristan. This incident trails the Baloch Liberation Army's recent hijacking of the Jaffar Express in the Bolan Valley.

title: Elon Musk claims Soros, Hoffman fund Tesla protests; Fortnite CEO agrees
content: Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney supports Elon Musk's claims that protests against Tesla are funded by billionaire donors, connecting it to Epic's battle with Big Tech. Sweeney criticizes deceptive funding of anti-Tesla campaigns and their violent fringes. Protests have intensified globally, reflecting dissatisfaction with Musk's political engagements, leading to notable incidents and public displays of disapproval.

title: Holi-Jumma row: Mehbooba compares UP CM Yogi to Zia-ul-Haq
content: PDP chairperson Mehbooba Mufti criticized the Uttar Pradesh CM for allegedly creating divisions between Hindus and Muslims. She warned this division could deteriorate the communal harmony, similar to Pakistan under Zia-ul-Haq. With Holi coinciding with Ramzan, leaders advised Muslims to stay indoors to avoid conflict.

title: Anupam Mittal on Singapore's Temasek buying 10% stake in Haldiram for $10 billion
content: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal reacted to Temasek’s acquisition of a 9-10% stake in Haldiram's, valuing it at nearly $10 billion. This deal marks significant foreign investment in India's FMCG sector, with Temasek aiming to expand its footprint in the rapidly growing market.

title: New rule for Canadians staying in the US for over 30 days amid Donald Trump's tariff war
content: Canadians who cross the northern border by land and stay for over 30 days do not need to register with the federal government. However, the new rule would require them to fill out a different form to enter the US, which is not a visa. Canadians never needed any form or visa to enter the US for casual travelling, tourism, shopping etc.

title: How Palestine activist Mahmoud Khalil exposed Trump & Musk on free speech
content: ​​Khalil’s arrest and possible deportation aren’t just about one man with an opinion the government doesn’t like; they’re about the bigger question of whether the First Amendment is truly for everyone or just for those who pass the political vibe check. If free speech really is the bedrock of democracy, why is a lawful permanent resident being shown the door for actually using it?

title: 'Most hostile': Trump threatens 200% tariff on European alcohol
content: US President Donald Trump has threatened to impose a 200 per cent tariff on French and European Union alcoholic products in response to the EU's 50 per cent tariff on American whiskey. The trade dispute escalates as the EU plans counter-tariffs worth €26 billion on various US goods.

title: Trump Tariffs: From 'Get over it' to 'I don't ...', has JPMorgan Chase CEO changed
content: Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase appears to be rethinking his support for Trump's tariffs amid US stock market decline, acknowledging their uncertainty for companies. Dimon had earlier defended them at WEF, viewing tariffs as economic tools. BlackRock CEO Larry Fink similarly expressed mixed concerns, seeing potential long-term benefits despite immediate economic strain.

title: 'You should have a replacement first': Sidhu backs Rohit to lead India in England Tests
content: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu supports Rohit Sharma as India's Test captain despite criticism over his recent form. Sidhu highlights Sharma's experience and previous successes, urging for a blend of seasoned players like Rohit, Virat Kohli, and KL Rahul with younger talents until the 2027 ODI World Cup to build a strong team.

title: 'CM acting like 9th Nizam': BJP on Holi celebration curbs in Hyd
content: Hyderabad police imposed restrictions for Holi celebrations, restricting group movement of vehicles and throwing colors on unwilling persons. BJP MLA Raja Singh criticized the move, calling it discriminatory and anti-Hindu, alleging influence from the Congress government. Restrictions are in effect from March 13 to March 15, with closure of wine shops and bars on March 14.

title: Stalin govt replaces Rupee symbol with Tamil letter; BJP mocks 'stupidity'
content: The Tamil Nadu government, led by MK Stalin, has replaced the Rupee symbol with the Tamil script 'ரூ' for the state's 2025-26 budget, sparking a renewed language debate with the Centre. BJP leaders criticized this decision, emphasizing the national significance of the Rupee symbol, initially designed by a Tamilian.

title: New TDS rules from April 1, 2025: Check out details
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Union Budget 2025 introduced significant modifications to TDS regulations. The changes include increased TDS thresholds for senior citizens, regular citizens, commission earners, and investors, effective from April 1, 2025.

title: Meet TN man who designed Rupee symbol & his DMK connection
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin replaced the rupee symbol with a Tamil script in the state budget amidst a controversy over 'Hindi imposition.' The rupee symbol was originally designed by Tamilian Udaya Kumar, whose work incorporated both Indian and universal design features.

title: UK scraps NHS England, puts healthcare mgmt back under govt control
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer announces that NHS England will be abolished, placing the NHS back under direct government control to cut bureaucracy and eliminate duplication. The decision aims to redirect funds to frontline services and bring NHS oversight back to politicians.

title: Khalil faces deportation: Should students in US with green cards be worried?
content: The arrest and potential deportation of Columbia graduate student Mahmoud Khalil have sparked outrage, raising concerns about green card holders’ rights in the US. Accused of posing a foreign policy risk, Khalil's pro-Palestinian activism led to his detention by ICE. A federal judge has temporarily blocked his deportation, but his future remains uncertain.

title: Abdul Razzaq better all-rounder than Hardik Pandya: Ex-Pak captain
content: Former Pakistan captain Mohammad Hafeez claims Abdul Razzaq was a better all-rounder than India's Hardik Pandya, citing Razzaq's untapped potential and past performances. Hafeez's views are echoed by Shoaib Akhtar, who praises Razzaq's impactful playing days and criticises the lack of recognition for Razzaq and Azhar Mahmood despite their consistent contributions.

title: 'Huge loss in biz': Doc, wife, and 2 sons found hanging at Chennai house
content: Four family members, including a doctor, his wife, and two sons, were found dead by hanging in their Anna Nagar West home. Initial investigations suggest the doctor faced financial difficulties in his scan business, possibly leading to their tragic deaths. The bodies were discovered by their driver, and the police have registered a case.

title: What is 'Pink Triangle'? Nazi era anti-LGBTQ symbol shared by Trump
content: President Trump shared an article featuring the Pink Triangle, once a Nazi symbol for gay men in concentration camps. His administration has rapidly altered LGBTQ+ policies, including banning transgender individuals from military service. The article highlights stark differences between Trump's military and Biden's, emphasizing aggression. The Pink Triangle's connection to the Holocaust raises significant concerns.

title: ‘Second-grade actor’: Congress MLA’s remark on Madhuri Dixit stirs row
content: Congress leader Tikaram Jully caused controversy by labeling Madhuri Dixit as a 'second-grade star' during a discussion about the IIFA event's benefits to Rajasthan. He claimed no top-tier actors, aside from Shah Rukh Khan, attended. BJP MLA Balmukund Acharya defended the event's importance.

title: Human hair, skulls: 'Rs 1500cr fraud' at Lilavati Hosp with black magic twist
content: Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital trust accused former trustees of misappropriating over Rs 1,500 crore and performing black magic on hospital premises. A forensic audit revealed large-scale financial irregularities. Multiple FIRs have been lodged, and the Economic Offences Wing is investigating. The hospital trust is urging swift action to ensure responsible individuals are held accountable.

title: Aamir Khan introduces his 'girlfriend' Gauri on his 60th birthday
content: Aamir Khan introduced his new girlfriend, Gauri, during his 60th birthday celebration. Previously married to Reena Dutta and Kiran Rao, Aamir has three children: Ira, Junaid, and Azad. Despite their separation, Aamir and Kiran maintain a professional and personal connection, emphasizing the importance of family and mutual respect. Aamir's son Junaid recently debuted in films.

title: Man kills wife for refusing to cook mutton curry in Telangana
content: A man in Upparagudem village, Mahabubabad district, killed his wife after she refused to cook mutton curry, leading to a fatal altercation. The victim, M Kalavathi, died from a head injury inflicted by her husband, M Balu, who has been taken into police custody.

title: Connor McDavid’s frustration sparks debate over his leadership as Oilers struggle
content: Connor McDavid, captain of the Edmonton Oilers, is facing criticism from fans after showing frustration during a loss to the Buffalo Sabres. Fans are questioning his leadership, blaming poor team direction and netminding. Some fans also criticize head coach Kris Knoblauch for not calling a timeout. The Oilers are preparing to face the New Jersey Devils next.

title: Inside Pant's sister's wedding: Dhoni, Raina & cricketer crew steal the show
content: Rishabh Pant's sister Sakshi married Ankit Chaudhary in a grand Mussoorie wedding. Cricket stars, including MS Dhoni, Suresh Raina, and Gautam Gambhir, attended and entertained with dance and singing. Notable moments included Pant's serenade and Dhoni's dance to "Dama Dam Mast Qalandar." The event was a joyous celebration filled with love and cricketing camaraderie.

title: British woman raped at south Delhi hotel by man she met on Instagram
content: A British national was allegedly raped and molested at a hotel in South West Delhi's Mahipalpur, leading to the arrest of a man and a housekeeping staff member. The woman, who met the accused through social media and arrived in India earlier this month, reported the incident to the police.

title: Is Anurag Kashyap's exit a wake-up call for Bollywood?
content: Anurag Kashyap's departure from Bollywood underscores his frustration with the industry's focus on profit over creativity. Renowned for his unorthodox storytelling, Kashyap seeks a fulfilling environment in regional cinemas. This shift points to a broader trend where filmmakers pursue creative freedom beyond Bollywood's commercial constraints, reshaping the landscape of Indian cinema.

title: Bhagyashree undergoes surgery after pickleball injury, gets 13 stitches
content: Actress Bhagyashree recently sustained a serious forehead injury requiring surgery while playing pickleball. Despite being away from mainstream cinema after 'Maine Pyar Kiya', she has made notable comebacks. Fans have wished her a speedy recovery through social media.

title: Sons make man, 103, spend 19 months in jail to stop land donation to gurdwara in UP
content: Gurdeep Singh, 103, spent over 19 months in jail after his sons falsely claimed to be attending court hearings, leading to his arrest. The elderly farmer wanted to donate land to a gurdwara, which his sons opposed. An NGO eventually secured his release.

title: Teacher gets 25 years in jail for raping 14-year-old student in Uttarakhand
content: A computer teacher in Pithoragarh, Uttarakhand, has been sentenced to 25 years in prison for raping his 14-year-old student at her home in August 2023. The court also imposed a fine of Rs 1.2 lakh and additional imprisonment for related charges, while providing compensation to the victim.

title: Watch: Sparks fly as Firefly's Blue Ghost lander drills into moon's surface
content: Firefly Aerospace's Blue Ghost lander successfully touched down on the moon, deploying experiments like the LISTER drill and NASA's Lunar Magnetotelluric Sounder. The lander will conclude its mission on March 16, after achieving its objectives and capturing images to study lunar dust at sunset.

title: Spike in Haryana poverty? Data shows 6-time jump in BPL families in 5 years
content: Haryana has seen a six-fold increase in poverty over the past five years, with 51.83 lakh families now below the poverty line. Despite the state government's various upliftment schemes, the data suggests that over two crore people in Haryana live in poverty, contrasting with claims of prosperity.

title: Scientist killed in brutal assault over parking row in Punjab's Mohali
content: A dispute over parking in Mohali's Sector 66 led to the death of 39-year-old scientist Abhishek Swarnkar. His neighbour Monty assaulted him despite knowing his fragile health. The incident was captured on CCTV. Swarnkar was declared dead upon arrival at the hospital. Police have registered a case, and further legal action is pending.

title: 2025 Tata Tiago NRG launched at Rs 7.2L: How's it different from regular model
content: The Tata Tiago NRG features new silver skid plates on both the front and rear bumpers, along with newly designed 15-inch wheel covers for the steel wheels. In addition to these updates, the NRG distinguishes itself from the standard Tiago with distinctive black side cladding, black roof rails, and an NRG emblem adorning the tailgate.

title: Are banks closed on March 13, 14 and 15? Check state-wise holiday list
content: Banks in various states will observe closures on March 13 and 14, 2025, due to Holi celebrations as per RBI guidelines. Physical branches will be closed, but digital banking services, including UPI payments and ATM operations, will remain available.

title: AB de Villiers on Rohit Sharma: 'Why would he retire?'
content: AB de Villiers praised Rohit Sharma for his leadership and batting after India's four-wicket victory over New Zealand in the ICC Champions Trophy final. Rohit top-scored with 76 runs and was named Player of the Final. De Villiers emphasised Rohit's impressive record and growth, dismissing retirement rumours and highlighting his significant contributions to Indian cricket.

title: Rishabh Pant's sister Sakshi turns traditional Kumaoni bride on her wedding
content: On March 12, 2025, Rishabh Pant's sister, Sakshi Pant, married her long-time partner Ankit Choudhary in a traditional Hindu ceremony. The wedding, attended by notable cricketers, featured Sakshi in a red lehenga and traditional Kumaoni jewellery, while Ankit wore an ivory Sherwani. The couple, who dated for ten years, got engaged in January 2024.

title: Ranya Rao gold smuggling case: ED raids multiple locations in Bengaluru, other places
content: The Enforcement Directorate conducted multiple raids in Karnataka in connection with a gold smuggling case involving actress Ranya Rao, who was arrested for attempting to smuggle gold from Dubai. Investigations point to a possible nexus with a smuggling syndicate, as additional officials and foreign nationals are also implicated.

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: free agency kicked off with the legal negotiation window on Monday . players can now officially sign with new teams as of 4 p.m. ET on monday . the new league year is the start of the new season .

title: End of an era: Pats cut longtime captain Andrews
content: sources say the new England Patriots will release former team captain David Andrews . the 32-year-old is rehabilitating from shoulder surgery that limited him to four games last season . if he chooses not to pursue extending his career elsewhere, the expectation is that the Patriots would hold a retirement ceremony .

title: Inside Mirra Andreeva's meteoric rise in 2025
content: Mirra Andreeva became the youngest player since 2009 to win an 1000-level title . the 17-year-old won the trophy in Dubai and became the first player to win a title in 2025 . on tuesday, andreeva made good on her audacious prediction .

title: Was Thunder-Celtics an NBA Finals preview?
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder defeated the Boston Celtics 118-112 in a blockbuster matchup . the Western Conference-leading Thunder have improved their record against Eastern Conference teams to 22-1 . despite the team tying the NBA record for 3-point attempts, the Celtics faltered late .

title: Wisconsin looks to cap one of the best seasons ever with a national title
content: team USA delivered the "Miracle on Ice," stunning the Soviet squad in the semifinals . "it always puts a smile on your face," says coach mark Johnson . 67-year-old is a lifetime removed from the Miracle .

title: 'The biggest sports story in Maine ever': The unlikely origin story of college basketball's most dominant player
content: the flag is pinned to the siding above the front door of Nemer's home . Nemer bought the flag the day Maine's favorite son committed to Duke . his facebook page is a shrine to Flagg, an endless scroll of highlights and stats .

title: Power Rankings: Knicks slip while the Warriors climb
content: the end of the regular season is a month away and one team has already clinched a playoff spot with several more on the brink . this week's Power Rankings takes stock of each team's health and how each should approach the final weeks of the season .

title: 'They took soldiers, executed them': Survivors recall Pak train hijacking ordeal
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Prez okays FIR against AAP's Sisodia, Jain in Rs 1,300 cr classroom scam case
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the toi news desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide .

title: 'Don't forcibly apply colours': UP CM says 'celebrate Holi in harmony'
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the toi news desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide .

title: Excavations discover remains of dwellings alongside burial sites in Idukki, a first in Kerala
content: Pottery fragments, including black and red ware, black ware, coarse red ware, and russet-coated painted ware, iron fragments, terracotta discs, stone and glass beads, and iron slags discovered from Aanappara

title: Over 60 POCSO cases registered in Kozhikode in past two months
content: Legal awareness among children leads to an increase in the registration of cases; PTAs seek appointment of counsellors in all schools

title: Headmaster punishes himself for poor performance of students; Lokesh reacts
content: After pleading with the students with folded hands to perform better in exams, Chinta Ramana did a ‘Sastanga Namaskar’ and sit-ups

title: Enhanced housing aid to benefit 17,898 in Chittoor district
content: State government has announced additional financial assistance of ₹50,000 to ₹1 lakh per beneficiary to support the construction of housing units for people from SC/ST and OBC communities, says Collector

title: 52 non-locals granted domicile in J&K’s Budgam district: Minister
content: Responding to queries raised by National Conference (NC) legislator Shafi Wani, Minister for Health and Education Sakina Itoo told the J&K Assembly that these 52 individuals obtained domicile rights through marriage within the Beerwah area

title: CPI(M) condemns demolition of Kasinayana Satram
content: Government’s act of recklessly targeting the dining hall, which has been serving the poor, common people, and pilgrims for centuries, is shameful, says the party State secretary

title: Centre has failed to identify ‘genuine beneficiaries’ for rural housing scheme: Parliamentary panel report
content: The scheme still relies on 14-year-old data from Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) of 2011 to find beneficiaries and the gap is a serious deficiency in the scheme’s implementation and requires urgent rectification, the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Rural Development said in its report

title: Tomato processing unit at Dudekonda to offer job opportunities for youth, says APFPS official
content: Industries, Commerce, and Food Processing Minister to lay the foundation stone on Friday for the Integrated Tomato Processing Unit to be built at a cost of ₹11 crore

title: Yogi doing a Zia-ul-Haq on Holi in U.P., says Mehbooba Mufti
content: The Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister recently said those who want to offer Friday prayers can do so from their homes, in the wake of Holi falling on a Friday. For Muslims, Friday in the month of Ramzan is the day for congregational prayers.

title: Aamir Khan Introduces Girlfriend Gauri, Friend Of 25 Years, On 60th Birthday
content: the actor hosted a press meet and greet session with the media . the highlight? the actor's girlfriend Gauri, whom he met 25 years ago . he said, "we are very serious and committed to each other"

title: State Investment Promotion Board approves investments worth ₹1,21,659 crore in Andhra Pradesh
content: They are expected to generate employment opportunities for about 80,000 people; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to closely monitor the projects until they materialise on the ground

title: CPI to join protest in support of demand for captive mines for VSP
content: Representatives are shamelessly requesting captive mines for the private Mittal Steel plant in Anakapalle while neglecting the losses faced by Visakhapatnam Steel in the public sector, he says

title: The many layers behind the mayhem
content: A spate of violent incidents involving students and teenagers, which included street fights and brutal attacks aimed at maiming or even killing their peers, have left the State shell-shocked. Several lives have been lost in the ghastly acts with the future of those involved turning bleak.  M.P. Praveen and  G. Krishnakumar attempt to understand the trigger factors forcing the teenagers into the gruesome acts

title: Kerala to set up interactive student migration portal to address challenges of student migration
content: The portal will also provide support networks for students in distress through diaspora connections and NoRKA help desks

title: MLA Vinay Kulkarni’s wife is misusing power, says BJP
content: The party leaders have accused Shivaleela Kulkarni of holding official meetings at various GPs despite not holding any constitutional position

title: Visakhapatnam’s Biodiversity Park turns 23: A botanical treasure with over 2,000 plant species
content: A peep into the microclimate marvel of the Biodiversity Park in Visakhapatnam situated at Rani Chandramani Government Hospital

title: Need to raise awareness about ban on single-use plastic at healthcare facilities: APPCB chairman
content: P. Krishnaiah unveils a poster on the ban of single-use plastic, urges representatives of IMA, APNA, CMBWTF to adopt the latest technologies in collection and treatment of biomedical waste

title: Duo arrested for drugging and robbing pilgrims at Tirumala
content: Police recover gold ornaments such as ‘mangalsutrams’, earrings, bangles, ₹45,000 in cash, three mobile phones, Diazepam tablets and a black Maruti Alto car from the accused

title: Sajad Lone flays J&K reservation policy; says it is a tool to disempower Kashmiri-speaking ethnic group
content: Figures suggest that the Kashmiri-speaking population who qualified for the JKAS examination was 19% in 2023, 25% in 2022 and 21% in 2021.

title: Section 144 lifted in Rayachoti; Minister Ramprasad Reddy appeals for peace and harmony
content: A minor altercation blown out of proportion by certain sections, he says, referring to the incident on March 4, which led to unrest among the two groups during a procession; urges all religious communities to live in harmony

title: Advisory issued to people to be safe from heat stroke
content: It comes in the wake of rising temperature and India Meteorological Department issuing forecast on heat waves in Dharwad

title: Five MLC candidates of NDA declared as elected unopposed
content: There were no other contenders for the seats as YSRCP did not field its candidates in the absence of the required no. of MLAs to win a post

title: Women must empower themselves, says SC judge
content: Although the Constitution grants women the right to live freely and independently, many are unable to enjoy those rights due to lack of awareness, says Justice Bhatti

title: Widespread irregularities in land deals of Palakkad brewery, says Anil Akkara
content: Former MLA Anil Akkara has submitted a complaint to the Speaker of the Kerala Legislative Assembly, demanding a probe into the disappearance of land records and the possible manipulation of land deals

title: Govt. cannot go back on agreement with SECI, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Blaming the previous YSRCP government for the crisis in the sector, Chandrababu Naidu has asserted that the agreements turned out to be a burden; as the previous government cancelled the PPAs inked during the TDP term, the State shelled out ₹9,000 crore, he says

title: Hearing aids distributed to 260 persons free of cost in Anantapur district
content: Hearing aids worth 40 lakh distributed to the needy with the Corporate Social Responsibility funds of Solar Energy Corporation Limited

title: Preparations on in Yadgir for smooth conduct of SSLC examination
content: The Deputy Commissioner has directed officers of the Education Department to take steps to stop malpractice during the exam

title: Pinarayi, Satheesan condemn protest against Tushar Gandhi
content: Neyyattinkara police have registered a suo motu case against identifiable BJP-RSS workers. CM terms it an attack on democracy and secularism. Leader of the Opposition says the RSS has put Kerala to shame

title: Save Oteru lake from encroachment: CPI
content: Many ponds have been encroached already and the attempt to encroach the British-era Oteru lake is a wicked act, says party’s national secretary

title: KRRS wants minimum support price for red chilli
content: Sangha members threaten to launch an agitation against the State and Central governments if they fail to address their demands immediately

title: Think differently and challenge conventions, Scientific Advisor to Defence Minister tells students
content: The former DRDO Chairman inspires students to innovate, work hard, and become future leaders in science and technology

title: Assam major source of pollution in Byrnihat: Meghalaya CM
content: Conrad K. Sangma said his State’s pollution monitoring stations in the border town have found the air quality to be satisfactory

title: Congress expresses concern over Airtel and Jio’s partnership with Elon Musk’s Starlink
content: Claiming that the PM brokered the deal to buy goodwill with the U.S. President, Congress raises concerns about national security implications; both telecom majors had previously opposed Starlink’s India entry

title: Kerala Agricultural University joins hands with Western Sydney University, NABARD to boost agri start-ups
content: Programme is being rolled out under the Rural Business Incubation Centre of NABARD with an allocation of ₹14.57 crore spread over a five-year period

title: Anantapur police to rope in NGOs to spread awareness among people
content: We have started innovative programmes like Cyber Suraksha and several other similar programmes to reach out to the people, says SP

title: APSBB moots biodiversity parks in cites of Andhra Pradesh
content: Local authorities, environmental NGOs, and eco-clubs would be brought together to create an urban biodiversity park that serves as a hub for education, conservation, and cultural activities in Tirupati, says official

title: Long-pending land issues of tribespeople find solution in Thrissur district
content: As part of these initiatives, title documents are being prepared for 44 tribal families at Olakara, with 1.5 acres each.   The process of land allocation for 106 landless tribal families identified in the district is progressing

title: Transgender devotees carve unobtrusive niches for themselves to offer Pongala
content: Transgender people have turned out in strength to offer Pongala at different locations in the city, compared to past years, says a devotee

title: Pawan Kalyan to unveil road map for Jana Sena Party at Pithapuram plenary on March 14
content: An estimated five lakh supporters are expected to turn up for the maiden plenary of the party after its thumping victory in 2024 elections

title: From forgotten creeks to thriving fish farm: Eraviperoor leads the way
content: Encouraged by the project’s success, the Iraviperoor panchayat now plans to expand this model to other neglected canals and ponds, turning the region into a freshwater fish farming hub.

title: No ban on Holi festivities in Santiniketan forest, says Bengal Forest Minister after political row
content: Leader of Opposition and BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari had alleged that restrictions on Holi festivities are part of the Mamata Banerjee government’s “divisive politics and politics of appeasement”

title: 1,682 km of sub-arterial stretches in Bengaluru to be white-topped
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar said there is no alternative to tunnel road to address traffic issues in the city, and added that tender will be called immediately

title: CM Siddaramaiah launches counter attack on BJP, says country’s loan burden under Modi increased from ₹53.11 lakh crore to ₹200 lakh crore
content: Countering allegations that the State’s loan burden had increased in his regime, the CM says the borrowings were well within the norms prescribed by Fiscal Responsibility Act

title: Fugitive Lithuanian national to be produced before Delhi court for extradition to U.S. on March 15
content: Aleksej Besciokov, wanted by the United States for operating cryptocurrency exchange ‘Garantex’, was nabbed in Varkala on Wednesday

title: Vigilance inquiry under way into ‘irregularities’ in Andhra University, says HRD Minister Lokesh
content: Stringent action will be taken against those involved, including former Vice-Chancellor Prasad Reddy, based on the inquiry report that has been sought within 60 days, the Minister informs the Legislative Assembly

title: Complaints related to beneficiary list prepared for Chooralmala rehabilitation project will be addressed: Minister
content: K. Rajan also said a humanitarian consideration would be extended to all while implementing the rehabilitation project in Chooralmala

title: Telangana’s Khammam Railway Station undergoing a ₹25.41 crore transformation
content: Khammam station which played a crucial role during British era, continued to grow importance post independence

title: BRS MLA Jagadish Reddy suspended for remainder of Telangana budget session
content: BRS MLAs staged dharna arguing that the suspension was to throttle the BRS party’s voice that was raising people’s issues

title: Odisha Crime Branch arrests Raja Chakra with ties to top BJD leadership
content: It emerges that Chakra was allegedly dominating the transportation of iron ore in the mineral-rich Keonjhar district, reportedly under the patronage of the BJD’s top leadership

title: Madras High Court fixes a cap on tourist vehicles to the Nilgiris, Kodaikanal
content: Only 6,000 tourist vehicles a day during weekdays and 8,000 vehicles during weekends will be allowed to the Nilgiris and 4,000 vehicles a day during weekdays and 6,000 during weekends will be allowed to Kodaikanal between April and June

title: Clash in Council over agencies hired to evaluate guarantee schemes of Karnataka
content: Leader of Opposition Chalavadi Narayanswamy asked what was the need to have a guarantee implementation committee on which ₹60 crore is being spent when private agencies have been hired to monitor the schemes.

title: Uttarakhand government seals over 50 ‘illegal’ madrasas in past two weeks
content: Government officials said almost all of the Madrasas found to have illegal and un-aurthorized construction

title: Karnataka proposes alternative to Navali balancing reservoir across Tungabhadra
content: The Deputy Chief Minister and Irrigation Minister D.K. Shivakumar told the Legislative Council on March 13 that he had sought an appointment with Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu to discuss the matter

title: Satire | Tamil Nadu should implement 14-language formula
content: The poorer a country and its government schools, the greater should be the number of languages forced upon its children

title: Watch: Historic Arani Jagir palace, a forgotten gem in Tamil Nadu
content: A decade after it was formed, the PWD’s heritage wing has turned its focus on restoring old palaces and zamin bungalows
